reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: UNDP Support for the Timorese Electoral Cycle

description.narrative: Timor-Leste?s presidential and legislative elections in 2007 were the first national post-independence elections organized by the Timorese and as such represented an important step in the consolidation of democracy in the country. The next parliamentary el ections are to be held in July 2012. The UNDP Support to the Timorese Electoral Cycle project using an Electoral Cycle Approach supports the capacity development of the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) in Timor-Leste: The Technical Secretariat for Elect oral Administration (STAE) and the National Commission on Elections (CNE) and the political parties. Based on the lessons learned from electoral support in Timor-Leste and in view of the need to further strengthen the human and institutional capacity of th e national electoral management bodies and political parties the project provides selected assistance in priority areas throughout the preparation and implementation of upcoming parliamentary elections. The activities are 1) advisory support for the STAE a nd CNE including expert and technical assistance in the pre-electoral period and individual mentoring in the post-electoral period and 2) support to voter and civic education in designing and producing a comprehensive range of voter and civic education cam paigns. The project activities cover all the districts of Timor-Leste and the duration of the project is from July to December 2012. The Timorese Electoral Cycle project is expected to conclude in December 2012.
